did.abstract: This collection contains 5 Silver Connections monographs by Philip Ashforth Coppola: Volume I (books 1 and 2), Volume III, and Volume IV. The collection also contains correspondence from Coppola to Poly/Tandon Prof. Bruce Garetz, an index to Silver Connections Volume I, and a copy of "One Track Mind," edited by Ezra Bookstein and Jeremy Workman with illustrations by Coppola (Princeton Architectural Press).
did.physdesc: Books were sent to NYU Conservation and received supportive treatment on the bindings in summer 2025.
did.physloc: This collection is housed in the Poly Archives, Bern Dibner Library, 5 Metrotech Center, Brooklyn, New York.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection contains 5 Silver Connections monographs by Philip Ashforth Coppola: Volume I (books 1 and 2), Volume III, and Volume IV. The collection also contains correspondence from Coppola to Poly/Tandon Prof. Bruce Garetz, an index to Silver Connections Volume I, and a copy of "One Track Mind," edited by Ezra Bookstein and Jeremy Workman with illustrations by Coppola (Princeton Architectural Press).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Tandon professor Bruce Garetz in 2025. The accession number associated with this gift is 2025-004.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been organized into two series: Series 1. Silver Connections Monographs; Series 2. Correspondance.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Philip Ashforth Coppola is an artist and writer living in New Jersey. His artwork has been featured in The New York Times, Hyperallergic, and other print media. Coppola's work is also part of the permanent collection of the National Arts Club, The Museum of Modern Art, and the S.I.B branch of the New York Public Library.

Coppola began his research for Silver Connections in 1978. Originally intended to be an article about the New York subway stations, Coppola transformed Silver Connections into a multi-volume set with a limited print run. Print run by volume varies, but no volume has more than 300 copies.
Project, SoHo Memory. "Silver Connections Books." Philip Ashforth Coppola.
